microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest subway station (look for green/red/yellow/blue/orange signs)
Use Citymapper app (best for NYC transit)
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Empire State, Statue of Liberty, Central Park)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - NYC is grid-based. Streets run east-west, avenues north-south. Most areas are walkable.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get MetroCard ($1 fee) or use OMNY (tap credit card) - $2.90 per ride
Swipe card at turnstile, wait for green light
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis during rush hour (7-9am, 5-7pm). Subway is faster and cheaper.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ride Share
actions: Yellow cabs: meter required, expensive ($15-30 short trips)
Use express trains during rush hour
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use subway for most trips. Taxis only for late night or heavy luggage.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Walk 2 blocks away for better prices.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
actions: Tipping: 18-20% restaurants, $1-2 per drink at bars
'I have allergies' - restaurants required to accommodate
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 7pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
actions: 'I have allergies' - restaurants required by law to accommodate
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. NYC restaurants are very accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
actions: Walk the High Line (free, elevated park)
Visit a local deli for a snack
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. NYC is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: Statue of Liberty (book online months ahead, or free Staten Island Ferry)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid peak times (10am-2pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Avoid: Some areas late at night (trust your instincts)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: NYC is generally safe, but stay alert in crowded areas.

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
actions: Ignore: 'free' CD givers (they'll ask for money)
Don't give money to aggressive beggars
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be direct but polite: 'No thanks' and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen (if foreign)
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - English is the language, but be direct and polite.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. NYC is fast-paced but people are helpful.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: NYC people are helpful but appreciate directness and not blocking sidewalks.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Find a park: Central Park, Bryant Park (free)
Caf√© break (coffee $3-5, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Times Square
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real NYC is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR museums OR shopping
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Find a hidden street or alley
Discover a tiny neighborhood you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at a neighborhood bar
Visit a local market and chat with vendors
Attend a free concert (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Visit a museum (many 'pay what you wish')
Caf√© culture: sit inside with a book

microSituations.title: Advanced Navigation
actions: Citymapper app (best transit app for NYC)
